A **gray dragon**, D, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is an adult [dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon") associated with the element of magic. Like all dragons, gray dragons are [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous"), [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous"), [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned"), can [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"), and are capable of [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight") - they will also seek out [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold"), [gems](/wiki/Gems "Gems") and [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item") to pick up.

Gray dragons have a [magic missile](/wiki/Magic_missile "Magic missile") [breath](/wiki/Breath "Breath") weapon, a strong bite attack, and two claw attacks, and possess [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance").

## Generation

Randomly generated gray dragons are always created hostile. A [baby gray dragon](/wiki/Baby_gray_dragon "Baby gray dragon") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a gray dragon.

Characters and monsters that [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing [gray dragon scales](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scales "Gray dragon scales") or [gray dragon scale mail](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scale_mail "Gray dragon scale mail") will turn into gray dragons.

Gray dragons may appear among the hostile D generated in [throne rooms](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room") at dungeon levels 15 and below, and can also appear among the monsters randomly generated by [looting](/wiki/Looting "Looting") a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") and carrying gold (provided there is no [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest") on the level).[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Gray dragons have a 1⁄3 chance of dropping a set of uncursed +0 gray dragon scales upon death unless [disintegrated](/wiki/Disintegrated "Disintegrated"), and the chance is reduced to 1⁄20 if the dragon was [revived](/wiki/Revived "Revived").

## Strategy

The gray dragon's intrinsic magic resistance compensates for its low [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") in a few areas, but does not protect it from elemental damage or other forms of magic such as a [wand of sleep](/wiki/Wand_of_sleep "Wand of sleep"), preserving most of a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero")'s options when in combat against one. Most characters encountering a gray dragon under normal circumstances will usually not have much to fear from their breath weapon in terms of damage.

Gray dragons are often sought out by characters looking to procure gray dragon scale mail and complement an existing or future source of [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"): they are a somewhat common target of [reverse genocide](/wiki/Reverse_genocide "Reverse genocide") for characters observing [wishless](/wiki/Wishless "Wishless") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct"), those that have not yet obtained a [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") or else those looking to save on one.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Gray dragons are one of the few dragons whose scales do not gain an additional extrinsic property.

Dragons and other large enough monsters can inflict knockback with their melee attacks, making them exceedingly dangerous to fight near [pools](/wiki/Pool "Pool") or [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava") and capable of forcing characters back into breath weapon range.

### As a pet

As pets and steeds, gray dragons sometimes compete with [silver dragons](/wiki/Silver_dragon "Silver dragon"): both possess flight, breath weapons, and immunity to death rays. The gray dragon is one of the few steeds to have intrinsic magic resistance, and it additionally stops them from being transformed by [polymorph traps](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap") (especially when [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding")); it is somewhat common for the gray dragon or its baby form to be the end result of leading pets onto the trap repeatedly. However, its low speed and lack of elemental resistances can still be a major drawback, and the silver dragon's reflection provides additional immunity to elemental rays. In addition, a gray dragon can still [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") if it eats a [chameleon](/wiki/Chameleon "Chameleon") or [doppelganger](/wiki/Doppelganger "Doppelganger") corpse.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Pets will no longer eat corpses that make them polymorph, unless they are starving or on the verge of becoming untame.

Monsters can gain intrinsics from eating corpses, meaning that a silver dragon can be fed in order to gain resistance against common pet-killers such as poison. In particular, silver dragons can gain [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), making it more likely that one brought to the [Elemental Planes](/wiki/Elemental_Planes "Elemental Planes") can survive through the [Plane of Fire](/wiki/Plane_of_Fire "Plane of Fire").

## History

The gray dragon first appears in [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e").

From [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0") to [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), including variants based on those versions, polymorphing a gray dragon corpse produces regular [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail"). [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0") introduces the current method of obtaining gray dragon scale mail.

## Variants

Many variants alter the gray dragon and other dragons to make them more varied and/or threatening.

### SLASH'EM

- *Main article: [Dragon (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Dragon_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dragon (SLASH'EM)")*

As with most other dragons in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the gray dragon's stats are improved: their [base level](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level") is raised to 18, their [difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") is raised to 25, their [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") is boosted to -4, their bite and claw attacks are stronger, and they [hit as a +3 weapon](/wiki/Hits_creatures_as_%2Bx_weapon "Hits creatures as +x weapon").

Gray dragons can appear in [dragon lairs](/wiki/Dragon_lair "Dragon lair") and [the Wyrm Caves](/wiki/The_Wyrm_Caves "The Wyrm Caves").

### NetHack brass

In [NetHack brass](/wiki/NetHack_brass "NetHack brass"), the gray dragon's speed is raised to 12.

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), the gray dragon's difficulty is slightly lowered to 19, their bite and claw attacks are stronger, and they are given an additional 2d10 engulfing attack that can [digest](/wiki/Digest "Digest") targets.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") and [DynaHack](/wiki/DynaHack "DynaHack"), all dragons have their breath weapons, resistances, and names randomized each game, allowing any non-[chromatic dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_dragon_\(UnNetHack\) "Chromatic dragon (UnNetHack)") to appear as gray - the default type of **magic dragon** is the tatzelworm.

Magic dragons may appear in [The Dragon Caves](/wiki/The_Dragon_Caves "The Dragon Caves"), in addition to generation rules from *NetHack*.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), gray dragons have their difficulty slightly raised to 21, and their effective AC is boosted to -4. The gray dragon's attacks are made stronger, with an additional 4d10 tailslap attack that they will use once every global turn, and their breath attacks also ignore reflection, unless the source is from [dragon armor](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)") or an artifact that grants dragonbreath reflection.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), gray dragons are buffed similarly to GruntHack: their attacks are made stronger as in GruntHack and reordered, including the addition of the digestion attack; they are also given [cancellation resistance](/index.php?title=Cancellation_resistance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Cancellation resistance (page does not exist)") and a [passive attack](/wiki/Passive_attack "Passive attack") that induces [cancellation](/wiki/Cancellation "Cancellation").

## Encyclopedia entry

In the West the dragon was the natural enemy of man. Although preferring to live in bleak and desolate regions, whenever it was seen among men it left in its wake a trail of destruction and disease. Yet any attempt to slay this beast was a perilous undertaking. For the dragon's assailant had to contend not only with clouds of sulphurous fumes pouring from its fire breathing nostrils, but also with the thrashings of its tail, the most deadly part of its serpent-like body.

\[ Mythical Beasts by Deirdre Headon (The Leprechaun Library) ]

  


"One whom the dragons will speak with," he said, "that is a dragonlord, or at least that is the center of the matter. It's not a trick of mastering the dragons, as most people think. Dragons have no masters. The question is always the same, with a dragon: will he talk to you or will he eat you? If you can count upon his doing the former, and not doing the latter, why then you're a dragonlord."

\[ The Tombs of Atuan, by Ursula K. Le Guin ]

From [[NetHack 3.0.0]] to [[NetHack 3.0.10]], including variants based on those versions, polymorphing a gray dragon corpse produces regular [[dragon scale mail]]. [[NetHack 3.1.0]] introduces the current method of obtaining gray dragon scale mail.

==Variants==
Many variants alter the gray dragon and other dragons to make them more varied and/or threatening.

===SLASH'EM===
{{Main|Dragon (SLASH'EM)}}
As with most other dragons in [[SLASH'EM]], the gray dragon's stats are improved: their [[Monster level|base level]] is raised to 18, their [[Monster difficulty|difficulty]] is raised to 25, their [[AC]] is boosted to -4, their bite and claw attacks are stronger, and they [[Hits creatures as +x weapon|hit as a +3 weapon]].

Gray dragons can appear in [[dragon lair]]s and [[the Wyrm Caves]].

===NetHack brass===
In [[NetHack brass]], the gray dragon's speed is raised to 12.

===GruntHack===
In [[GruntHack]], the gray dragon's difficulty is slightly lowered to 19, their bite and claw attacks are stronger, and they are given an additional 2d10 engulfing attack that can [[digest]] targets.

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]] and [[DynaHack]], all dragons have their breath weapons, resistances, and names randomized each game, allowing any non-[[Chromatic dragon (UnNetHack)|chromatic dragon]] to appear as gray - the default type of '''magic dragon''' is the tatzelworm.

Magic dragons may appear in [[The Dragon Caves]], in addition to generation rules from ''NetHack''.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]], and [[notnotdNetHack]], gray dragons have their difficulty slightly raised to 21, and their effective AC is boosted to -4. The gray dragon's attacks are made stronger, with an additional 4d10 tailslap attack that they will use once every global turn, and their breath attacks also ignore reflection, unless the source is from [[Dragon armor (dNetHack)|dragon armor]] or an artifact that grants dragonbreath reflection.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], gray dragons are buffed similarly to GruntHack: their attacks are made stronger as in GruntHack and reordered, including the addition of the digestion attack; they are also given [[cancellation resistance]] and a [[passive attack]] that induces [[cancellation]].
